Make League more flexible.

The rotating queue is great, but the weekends-only thing stinks.
I can understand Riot wanting to put some breaks in between modes--the excitement and anticipation would probably wane is there was a mode constantly active with no breaks. Additionally they want to maintain a good ratio of available/unavailable for each mode--even URF started losing some appeal near the end and Riot needs to make sure there is plenty of time for each mode to be a bit forgotten and then build up hype again before it come back around. Additionally, modes like URF and Doom Bots need extra time for Riot to tune and balance them as the game and champs are always evolving.

Still though, I feel weekends only is a bad call. Instead, I think it would be better to have each mode last a little over a week; it starts on Friday, is active through the weekend, the following week, the next weekend, and the ends early morning on that FOLLOWING Monday. Then there is a work week with no Rotating Queue active until the Friday, when the next mode goes live.

This system would give us more time with each mode--and give us some non-weekend time with it. It would also ensure there was a break as long as the current one between each new queue. Lastly it would put modes on a 2 week rotation (a weekend, a week, and another weekend on; followed by a week off) which helps ensure that there is still plenty of time between each mode coming around again, allowing any meta that had begun to assert itself time to fade (from memories and through champion and item updates/releases). This would ensure that once we get through a cycle of all the available modes and ones start coming up again, they remain fresh.

tl:dr - please Rito, make rotating queue a week on/week off cycle instead of weekends!

Thanks anyone who bothered to read all that and thanks Riot for a great game (even when there is always room for improvement)!

Dear Riot,
I really like the idea of the Rotating Queue, but I still think that Feature Game Mode Events should be a thing.

One of the most special things about URF was that it came on April 1st, (At least for me).  I loved the idea of such a rude and somewhat mean spirited day, could take on a more fun and crazy twist.

One of the main reasons I like the Rotating Queue is because it gives us a chance to play those Featured Game modes that just can't happen this year.  If we honestly look at the past years, not every Featured Game Mode had gotten its Two weeks of glorious craziness.  I love the idea, but I also loved getting to play the Game Modes drawn out over the course of two full weeks, instead of Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.

I'm generally not the best person when if comes to the comment sections, and I generally get hate on what I post, but for once I really hope that the community is behind me, or with me on this one.

Signed,
The Icaran Flames aka Gamebird8
